parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported. A primary verb; to hear.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A learner, disciple, pupil. From manthano; a learner, i.e. Pupil.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Hard, violent, harsh, stern. From the base of skelos; dry, i.e. Hard or tough.
From lego; something said; by implication, a topic, also reasoning or motive; by extension, a computation; specially, the Divine Expression.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I am powerful, have (the) power, (b) I am able, I can. Of uncertain affinity; to be able or possible.
To hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported. A primary verb; to hear.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
